newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia searches for missing Busang geologist.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia searches for missing Busang geologist.

text.p: Indonesian rescuers resumed searching on Thursday for Filipino geologist Michael de Guzman, who fell out of a helicopter on his way to the huge Busang gold property in East Kalimantan that he helped discover.

Search And Rescue (SAR) officials said de Guzman, chief geologist for Calgary-based Bre-X Minerals Ltd, fell from about 800 feet (240 metres) on Wednesday morning after the back door of the Alouette 3 helicopter burst open.
The Busang motherlode, estimated by Bre-X to contain at least 80 million ounces of gold currently worth around $25 billion, is the biggest gold find this century.
"The search operations resumed this morning after being halted at sunset yesterday," a SAR official based in Samarinda, capital of East Kalimantan, told Reuters by telephone.
A senior executive of the public relations company that represents the joint venture company set up to develop the Busang property said de Guzman was presumed dead.
The SAR official said the helicopter had been chartered by Bre-X from PT Indonesia Air Transport and was piloted by Captain Eddy Tursono, who was accompanied by an engineer.
"The helicopter was chartered by Bre-X and had flown from Balikpapan to Samarinda, where it stopped to refuel. It then took off for Busang with all three on board," he said.
He said the helicopter was about 25 nautical miles from Samarinda when the back door flung open.

"The pilot looked back and de Guzman was missing," he said. "The pilot then circled the area for about 20 minutes but could not find de Guzman. The pilot was then ordered by the Samarinda airport authority to return."
The official said the local military command in East Kalimantan was conducting searches on the ground, which he described as swampy.
Bre-X chief executive David Walsh told Reuters from Calgary: "It's very tragic and he will be remembered as a fine geologist."
Bre-X reached an agreement with Indonesian partners and the U.S. mining giant Freeport McMoRan Copper and Gold Inc to develop Busang.
